value.title: PowerBI.Tips - Tutorial - ALM ToolKit with Christian Wade
value.excerpt: The ALM Toolkit is an excellent tool for aiding users with Tabular Model management.  Christian Wade has been generous enough to provide us with a detailed tutorial on the ALM ToolKit.    ALM Toolkit provides the following features: - Database Compare - Code Merging - Easy Deployments - Source-Control

In this video Daniel teaches us how to use the Best Practice Analyzer.    The Best Practice Analyzer can review your model for code errors, or common

value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Darren Gosbell the creator of DAX Studio will be giving a live demo of his tool.    In this live webinar Darren will be giving a full overview of all the features of DAX Studio.  - https://daxstudio.org/documentation/features/  Watch the Full Tutorial Series:

value.excerpt: DAX Studio is the tool for data model tuning.  Marco Russo contributor to DAX Studio will be giving us a deep dive and demo around using DAX Studio for Model Performance Tuning.   You will not want to miss this event as Marco is a wealth of knowledge for all things Data Modeling!  Watch the Full Tutorial

value.title: Dataflow Vs  Dataset   What are the Differences of these two Power BI Components
value.excerpt: I have presented about Power BI dataflow and datasets a lot, and always one of the questions I get is: What is the difference between dataflow and dataset. So I thought better to explain it in a post and help everyone in that understanding. In this video, you will learn what the differences between these

value.title: Power BI Is Too Much for One Person   Roles in the Power BI Development
value.excerpt: Power BI is a tool that you can get started working with it in a few hours, but to use it in its full potential, these days, you require to have many skills. The variety of solutions and BI implementations is also dictating to have different roles, positions, jobs in the Power BI development market.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/I-D7IXGXDXs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Modeling Tip   Snapshot Table or DAX Measures
value.excerpt: I often get this question: ‚ÄúIs it better that I create this calculation as a snapshot table in Power Query (or T-SQL, or the data source), or write DAX measures for it?‚Äù If you ever had a scenario of creating a report of snapshots, you know what I mean. ‚ÄúShould I have a table for inventory stock on hand

value.title: What Do You Need to Implement Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI
value.excerpt: I have explained in some videos about the RLS topic already. Through my consulting experience, however, I get the feeling that many people can‚Äôt easily move from static RLS to dynamic. If you know what are things you need to have the dynamic RLS implemented, it makes the whole process simple. So this

value.title: Analyzing a slow report query in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Investigate a slow query in a Power BI report using DAX Studio, looking at the query plan and the server timings. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ Optimizing DAX Workshop: https://www.sqlbi.com/p/optimizing-dax-video-course/

value.title: Connecting Excel to Power BI Desktop using DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can connect Excel to Power BI Desktop copying the connection string from Power BI Desktop. Useful to test your model for Excel consumption before publishing to Power BI service.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MVuEzcK0Rag" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZIJDv3J9kko" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hrhEjg9yYvE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using CONCATENATEX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video showcases the use of CONCATENATEX, a handy DAX function to return a list of values in a measure. Article and download: https://sql.bi/206871
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6gCk4UoOw0g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using USERELATIONSHIP in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to use the USERELATIONSHIP function in DAX to change the active relationship in a CALCULATE function. Article and download: https://sql.bi/664175
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zZLH8Y1tO1g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Track wild polar bears with AI
value.excerpt: Detect and track polar bears through photos using AI, then use Power BI to show where polar bears are being spotted.

images.title: Track wild polar bears with AI

value.title: Create and share your first Power BI report
value.excerpt: With Power BI you can create compelling visuals and reports. In this module you learn how to use Power BI Desktop to connect to data, build visuals, and create a report that you can share with others in your organization. Then you learn how to publish the report to the Power BI service, and let others see your insights and benefit from your work.
